title: What was Baghdad like before the Mongols invaded? - Quora

response.answer_text: Wasn't so great, it should not be confused with circular Baghdad that has been abandoned after 50 years of creating it. Other Baghdad which is Al-Rusafa currently has been described by many historians as a miserable city that’s nearly abandonded in different times before the Mongols (such as during the rule of Al-Mustaien الخليفة المستعين). I’ve read about the Mongols invasion from different sources and there were few significant beautiful buildings in the city, ah and there’s nothing such as 1 million or 30 million population in Iraq at that time, and I doubt what has been told about the river getting blue because the Mongols are throwing the books in the water, the most valuable books were saved and moved by Al-Tusi to Maragha.
baghdad was in decline before the mongol attack, but it still contained splendid libraries and beautiful mosques, over a million people, nourished by the wealth of the middle east.
